results.title: Chemical bonding and atomic structure. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur, Coronet Films and Don Lane Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
The substances forming our world are composed of atoms held together by powerful electrical forces called chemical bonds. The physical and chemical properties of elements and compounds depend on the nature of these bonds. Discusses metallic, ionic, covalent and interatomic bonds and forces dealing with ions, atoms, crystals, valence, polarity and Van der Waals forces. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Solutions: ionic and molecular. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Illustrates the chemical nature of a solution, what happens when it forms and the role of the electrostatic forces. Shows Brownian movement, defines saturation and presents the concept of molarity along with an explanation of why some substances, eg oil, won’t dissolve in other substances such as water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: 4 years-6 years = Four years to six years
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Dorothy Courtois, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Child”.
By the age of four the child is curious about the world around him. To find out, he is asking thousands of questions. He is also learning not to be afraid. This film shows children in learning situations: on a nature hike; handling animals and other creatures; dealing with their peers. One particularly interesting example is that of Ingrid and Helen, twins who look alike but act differently.

results.title: Acids, bases and salts. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Differing in their reaction with indicators, acids can be defined as proton acceptors using the Bronsted-Lowry theory. The Lewis theory is also explained, as well as the meaning of pH.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur and Coronet Films

results.title: Debbie and Robert: 12-24 months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Child”.
Debbie and Robert’s behaviour is typical of the second year of life. Illustrates the process of learning that goes on through every waking hour, and the kind of guidance a parent can give.

results.title: Kathy and Ian: three-year-olds
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child”.
By the age of three children become aware of themselves as unique. This happens through their continuing interaction with parents, siblings and friends. This film explores these relationships and the resulting development within the child.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Chemical bond and atomic structure
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Discusses the structure of the atom and shows how the electrons help determine the way in which the atom bonds chemically with other atoms. Shows three types of chemical bonding and explains how bonding affects substance. (Suitable for years 11-12)
